subject: RE: [junit] Naming convention for TestAll classes
msgSnippet: Name them after the packages themselves. e.g.  com.foo.database.tests contains all tests for com.foo.database as well as a suite called _DatabasePackageTests

Name them after the packages themselves.

e.g.  com.foo.database.tests cont=
ains all tests for com.foo.database as
well as a "suite" called _DatabasePa=
ckageTests or
ComFooDatabasePackageTests or ...

You get the idea.

[junit] Naming convention for TestAll classes


Hello All,
I build Test cla=
sses in many packages and now I want make some 
AllTest classes on differen=
t level of package hierarchy and in 
different packages (and one root AllTe=
st class too). These TestAll 
classes can compose all test in subpackages.
=
But I am confused about naming convention for these classes. For root 
Test=
 class it's simple, name can be AllTest or TestAll, but what 
names can I a=
ssign to other? I looked for some convention, but there 
are only conventio=
n for packages or method naming, not for this 
problem. Have somebody some =
experience with this?

Example package structure (each level with few Test =
classes):
A
A.a
A.a.1.xxx
A.a.2.yyy
A.b
A.b.1.xxx
A.b.2.xxx

If I name all =
test classes composing some other test as "TestAll", 
there can be confusio=
n later (many classes with name "TestAll"), if I 
name it "TestAllXXX", whe=
re XXX is name of last level of package, 
there can be still packages with =
same name of the last level. 
Assigning name as TestAll_A_a_1 (thus full na=
me of package in name of 
class) is for me too long. Some advice?

Thanx

Z=
denek Smid
